author: Five Binaries
title: Localize Yoroi for Czech market
description: Yoroi is missing Czech localization making it difficult to use on the local market.

assessments.note:
I don't see how translating a user facing app improves the developer ecosystem at all.
This translation could even be done by the users themselves using crow based platform and just pull requests in GitHub.
assessments.reply: The challenge focus includes "... A wide variety of resources are provided for developers allowing them to focus on business value they can generate and not on infrastructure ..." and we feel this is the case too. If the Yoroi wallet is translated and it provides an interaction frontend to the end user, the developer does not need to care about compliance and can focus on developing its project. Also, this transaltion is now open to community for several months but no one is translating it.

assessments.note: Creating localised content for Czech developers seems a reasonable use of funds. Is it a priority project with sustainable outcome? Difficult to answer but valid concept that applies to all localised content.

assessments.note:
This proposal is not strictly related to the experience of the developers but would improve the experience of all users in a given region in case they have difficulties with English. Thus it could increase the number of developers actively building on top of Cardano.
As identified in the proposal it could also help with regulatory procedures in Europe. This could also lead to an improved developer ecosystem.

In this proposal you state: "Many jurisdictions, mostly on European markets, have consumer protection laws that make it difficult to introduce an application without a localized interface.". 
If this is the case, then many dApps would be hard to introduce and maintain on these markets without some bigger type of coordination. An example of a restrictive law or condition would increase the credibility of this proposal. 
Could this proposal be more generalized and valid for all languages that need to be translated? A community driven platform for translations or something similar? The community seems happy to help in this aspect according to the comments.
It is hard to identifying a clear connection between this proposal and the key metrics given the 'Developer Ecosystem' campaign brief. Can you try to clarify this further in your proposal?
This proposal offers a year worth of support for localizing a specific market, it is unclear if this really is considered impactful given this particular campaign. 
I will rate this a (2) in terms of impact with the current information available. Note that this assessment is posted in Localize Yoroi for Czech market and also for the Slovak market since both proposals are almost identical.

The problem and solution description is reasonable and objective. Yoroi's location is an important implementation, but that implementation is more in line with the Dapps & Integrations challenge, so I recommend submitting the proposal there.

assessments.note: This would be an extremely easy proposal to audit, either the translation would be completed or it wouldn't. It really wouldn't leave much grey area in that regard.

This proposal promises localization for a smaller specific market during a year for 2500 dollars worth of compensation. The proposer does not mention any obligations or promises to uphold the translations within a reasonable timeframe after new updates. Provide details about your obligations in terms of deadlines in order to increase the credibility of the proposal overall.

In a perfect world, all apps and platforms would be available in every language. It all comes down to ROI in this case. You ask for 2500 dollars worth of funding for this proposal (Czech  market) as well as for the Slovak market, that is 5000 dollars worth of funding in total. 
Will 5000 dollars worth of ADA to these two proposals contribute to more ROI to the community then other proposals in this campaign? It is hard to judge if this proposal is impactful given the funding. In terms of auditability, the proposal seems plausible. Since the proposal is hard to assess I will take a neutral standing an give this proposal a rating of (3).
Note that this assessment is posted in the 'Localize Yoroi for Czech market' and '...for Slovak market' since both proposals are very similar.
